#Text=Become an RSPCA Inspector

#Text=The Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals ( or RSPCA ) is an organization based in the United Kingdom that investigates and take steps to prevent and/or intervene upon poor treatment of animals .
#Text=An RSPCA inspector is a highly trained employee who does the actual work of investigating and intervening , often encountering conflict .
#Text=In order to enter this rewarding career path , you must meet several basic qualifications and undergo a multi-step application process .
#Text=Before doing so , you must also consider the social , physical , and psychological strains of this demanding career .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Meeting Basic Qualifications
#Text=Pass five GCSEs .
#Text=The first qualification necessary to become an RSPCA inspector involves passing at least five GCSE ( General Certificate of Secondary Education ) exams with a grade of C or better .
#Text=Of these exams , one must be Maths , and one English .
#Text=Obtain a UK driver ’s license .
#Text=In order to qualify for work as an RSPCA inspector you must have a valid UK driver ’s license .
#Text=You must also be able to operate a vehicle with a fully manual transmission .
#Text=Practice swimming .
#Text=Some of your work as an RSPCA inspector can involve water .
#Text=As such , strong swimming ability is important .
#Text=In order to qualify for the role of RSPCA inspector , you must be able to swim fully clothed within 2.5 minutes .
#Text=Gain experience working with animals .
#Text=In order to work with the RSPCA , it is required for you to have experience working with animals .
#Text=You can gain experience by volunteering with an animal welfare charity , animal refuge , or ideally for an RSPCA animal care center .
#Text=Ensure that you are in good physical shape .
#Text=This job can be physically demanding , requiring you to lift heavy objects or animals , run , and/or swim .
#Text=As such , your physical health and ability will be taken into consideration .
#Text=Be sure that you are in very strong physical health , and perhaps even begin training , before you apply .
#Text=Begin swimming daily .
#Text=You may want to run and/or lift weights .
#Text=Consider your diet .
#Text=Focus on consuming veggies , fruit , lean meats , and whole grains .
#Text=Gaining a Position with the RSPCA
#Text=Apply to be a trainee .
#Text=If you find yourself suitably qualified , the next step is to locate a trainee opening with a local RSPCA chapter .
#Text=You can visit the RSPCA website to search job openings .
#Text=When you find an opening near you , submit your application online .
#Text=To apply you will send a curriculum vitae ( or resume ) and cover letter , along with a brief application .
#Text=In these materials , you will outline the ways in which you meet various minimum qualifications , as well why you are a good fit for the position .
#Text=Complete an interview and assessment .
#Text=If you are chosen to move on to the next level , you will be invited to a Selection Board Interview , where you will be asked about your background and criminal history .

#Text=If you pass this phase ( called Preliminary Declaration ) , you will then be asked to participate in a series of psychometric assessments , as well as a physical examination and fitness assessment .
#Text=Based on the results of these tests , the selection board will determine whether or not you are suitable for this role .
#Text=Undergo 7-12 months of training .
#Text=If you are selected to move on as an RSPCA trainee , you will head into your first of 26 training modules . ( You must pass all 26 to qualify ) .
#Text=Each module will take between one and eight weeks , and you must pass all 26 within one year of registering for your first .
#Text=Lodging and board is provided during training modules .

#Text=Training modules will cover subject areas including : investigation skills and interview techniques , court work , media and public speaking , boat rescue techniques , and basic veterinary and animal-handling skills .
#Text=Typically , training modules must be completed in a consecutive order .
#Text=Pass a swimming assessment .
#Text=Near the beginning of your training , you will be asked to undergo a swimming assessment .
#Text=Some of your time working the RSPCA may be on , in , or around water , so being able to swim well is a crucial component of the job .
#Text=For this assessment , you will be expected to swim fully clothed in 2.5 minutes or less .
#Text=Receive a job offer with the RSPCA .
#Text=After you have completed your training , you will be given an official job offer by the RSPCA .
#Text=Be aware that this job may require you to relocate to a new area .
#Text=Congratulations ! You have succeeded in becoming an RSPCA inspector .
#Text=Considering the Demands
#Text=Understand that the hours are “ unsociable . ”
#Text=As an RSPCA inspector , you will regularly be asked to work evenings , weekends , and holidays .
#Text=These hours and dates will not be negotiable , so it is important to consider if you will be happy with the schedule before pursuing this career .
#Text=Recognize that there will be lots of driving .
#Text=A major component of this career is time spent on the road .
#Text=If you become an RSPCA inspector , understand that you may travel over 25,000 miles ( 40,234 kilometers ) each year .
#Text=You must operate a manual transmission vehicle , traveling across both urban and rural landscapes .
#Text=Be aware of the physical demands .
#Text=Working as an RSPCA inspector involves periods of very high physical activity .
#Text=You may need to run and swim .
#Text=You may need to work at heights , or in confined spaces .
#Text=You will also be required to lift heavy cages , and carry , haul , and otherwise handle animals .
#Text=Consider the psychological demands .
#Text=Perhaps even more taxing than the physical demands of working for the RSPCA are the psychological demands .
#Text=You will experience a great deal of confrontation with other humans , and you must be able to stand your ground .
#Text=You will encounter animals in poor situations .
#Text=You may need to restrain or even euthanize an animal .
#Text=All of this can be hard on the average person .
#Text=Asses your communicative abilities .
#Text=In order to succeed as an RSPCA inspector , you must have exemplary communication skills .
#Text=You must be able to defuse situations and confrontations .
#Text=You must be able to talk yourself out of difficult situations .
#Text=Most of all , you must be able to communicate clearly , concisely and assertively .
#Text=Tips
#Text=You have to be able to withstand working by yourself for long periods of time .
#Text=A friendly , confident person stands more chance of becoming an RSPCA Inspector than a shy , quiet person .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=This career is not recommended if you are allergic to some animals .
#Text=You must not be afraid of certain animals , for example : spiders or snakes . ( If you are then you must learn to overcome your fear ) .
#Text=A conviction within the past 10 years for a number of criminal offenses may result in your application being rejected .
#Text=Quick Summary
